title: Caterham Walks

images.title: Caterham Viewpoint by Ian Capper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Trees on Coulsdon Common

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / Coldstream Road, The Village, Caterham
images.caption: Coldstream Road, The Village, Caterham. The Village is a large and very high-class development on the site of the old Guards barracks in Caterham. Accommodation of all types is provided, from flatlets to large family homes.

images.title: Hywel Williams / View Point on the North Downs  Near Caterham
images.caption: View Point on the North Downs Near Caterham

images.title: Hywel Williams / Water Tower on Gravelly Hill
images.caption: Water Tower on Gravelly Hill. One of many water towers that can be seen on the North Downs. Most as this one have found a new use in recent times as mobile phone masts.

images.title: Ian Capper / Quarry Hangers Nature Reserve
images.caption: Quarry Hangers Nature Reserve. Owned by the Surrey Wildlife Trust. An unimproved meadow in the foreground with downland on the North Downs scarp behind.

images.title: Peter Trimming / Bridleway on Farthing Downs
images.caption: Bridleway on Farthing Downs

images.caption: Trees on Coulsdon Common

description: This Surrey town is located near Woldingham and Warlingham in the Tandridge district of the county. Local walking highlights include the circular Woldingham Countryside Walk which explores the North Downs to the south and east of the town. It additionally visits Botley Hill , the highest point of the Downs. To the west is the Coulsdon South Circular Walk where you can explore the popular Farthing Downs . This walk from the town uses part of the London Loop and the North Downs Way to visit the Gravelly Hill viewpoint,  Happy Valley and Farthing Downs. You can start off from the car park at the Gravelly Hill Caterham viewpoint which lies just to the south of the town. There's some nice trails around the hill and into the surrounding Old Park Wood. You can then follow the North Downs Way north west through the Caterham Valley to Quarry Hangers Nature Reserve, Chaldon, Happy Valley and Farthing Downs where there are some lovely woodland trails and countryside views to enjoy.
